attributes.action: Support the setup of educational foster care homes - like free schools.
attributes.background:
I am a Primary School Teacher and a Foster (Kinship) Carer. For many years I have seen and taught children who are in care - Looked After Child (LAC). These children need us! 
An educational foster home could offer stability, consistency, care and love and deliver fantastic outcomes for children.
attributes.additional_details:
Nearly 64,000 children live with almost 55,000 foster families across the UK each day. This is nearly 80% of the 81,000 children in care away from home on any one day in the UK. 

The Government's DfE paper states: “Where birth parents cannot meet a child’s basic needs it is one of the state’s most important responsibilities to step in and ensure that children can have a childhood which keeps them safe and enables them to flourish." 

With a UK shortage of foster carers this petition can help!

attributes.action: To allow free parking for up to three hours on all NHS hospital car parks.
attributes.background: The NHS state that they are making no profit from car parking charges, this cannot be correct when a Press Association report states that the NHS raised £120,000,000 (120 Million pounds sterling) from charges last year, up 5%.

attributes.action: Make MP's send yearly report to their constituents.
attributes.background: In a time of information and misinformation I propose that MP's send a report to each of their constituents outlying which bills they have voted for, against or abstained. Their attendance in office and parliament and their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: As public servants and representatives of the people, MP's should send information of what they have voted for (on our behalf), so we can decide if we choose to keep them in office. I am aware that this information is in the public domain, but is not readily available to us all. In a society where we celebrate  democracy, the MP's should be happy for us to see what they are doing and allow us to celebrate their achievements by voting them in next time.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to show ID for age restricted products being purchased
attributes.background: Retail workers are fed up of being yelled at unfairly for following procedure when requesting ID for age restricted goods. They are at risk whenever a sale goes through. NO ID = NO SALE means a drastic reduction in this risk, and the onus is on consumers - NOT retail workers.
attributes.additional_details: I'm a retail worker. The very day i started this petition, i had been yelled at by a customer for requesting ID in order to ensure i could process the sale of Vodka. DVDs, Video Games, Fireworks, Knives. NO ID = NO SALE means the cashier is no longer at risk, has confidence to check ID without fear of intimidation and consequence,  put's the onus on the customer to ensure they have ID. This simple change would help prevent under age sales, knife crime, and give everyone confidence in the system.

attributes.action: Youths 14-18 required to be CRB checked if working at a youth organisation
attributes.background: Children at youth organisations in the UK are being put at risk as there is no current guidelines or law allowing a youth worker/leader to check on the Sex offenders register about a person who is under 18.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to change to allow a youth who will be mixing with children to be checked against the register, as under 18 no CRB checks are ever made and this is dangerous.

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: Ban drinking alcohol in Parliament by MP's
attributes.background: Alcohol at work is not allowed as it is unsafe and people can make decisions that when they were sober they may consider what they did was inappropriate.  So why when the interest of the UK is being debated and voted on by MP's are they allowed to be under the influence of alcohol.

attributes.action: Please don't wage another war in the ME after Iraq,Libya,Afghanistan now Syria!
attributes.background: Please send no troops, SAS special forces and clandestine operations into Syria. Unless Syria declares war on us, we shell stay neutral and not get involved in this war. We have our own country to care for. And we caused enough suffering and damage to the Middle East already. Please save the peace!
attributes.additional_details: The war on Iraq was based on a lie. The war on Libya caused death and suffering to the Libyan Nation and extreme damage to the security of Europe and the whole world. Yemen was bombed for many years by drones now by Saudis. Afghanistan is turning back into a unsafe war torn country under the rule of Taliban. Please save Syria and stay out of it. Let the Syrian Government and their Allies deal with their problem. Its not our Country. Not our war. We have a beautiful country to care for!

attributes.action: Make Healthy start vouchers available to all low income families
attributes.background: Poverty does not only exist in non-working families. The ability to access fruit, vegetables and milk is essential but not always possible for low income families that work. Healthy growth and development should be of paramount importance for this government, allowing the working poor to thrive.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if we can make this change we will reap the benefits as a nation within a small amount of time. We will see the general health of families on low incomes improving meaning less strain on our hospitals and doctors surgeries. People less likely to eat sweets and high sugar foods so will see an improvement in oral health the wider implications are endless.

attributes.action: All products with gelatine must be labelled clearly,animal or vegetable gelatine
attributes.background: There are many products on the market which contain gelatine. Gelatine is found in our foods, sweets and in our pharmaceutical products,these are just a few examples. Clear labelling on EVERY product that contains gelatine and what type of gelatine it is, be it from animals or vegetables.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of Cold Calling In All Areas Of The UK
attributes.background: We the people of the United Kingdom would like to petition the UK Government to place a ban on all forms of cold calling in all areas of the UK (England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland).
attributes.additional_details:
People across the UK regularly receive cold calls through a number of methods... door to door, telephone etc from sales, PPi and many more. It is believed that a lot of people find this to be anti social and crime related to cold calling would appear to be on the rise, especially with the elderly, people with mental health issues and people at risk.

Door to door cold calling can be unsettling & telephone cold calling can be a nuisance as opt out services such as TPS don't seem to work.

attributes.action: Revision of Universal Credit system for people with mental health issues
attributes.background: Currently the Government is in the process of transfer all authorities from ESA to Universal Credit.  Therefore, people with mental health issues are struggling to get the financial support they are entitled to as with the new system focuses on work rather than understanding of mental health needs.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is the application process difficult to complete once the claim is running unlike ESA that respected a GP's fit note Universal Credit expects you to fulfil commitments some of which are unrealistic, for example arrangement of face-to-face interview at the job centre for somebody suffering from agoraphobia... If commitments are not adhered to then you are sanctioned ...i am sure you get the picture and ask you to please support this petition.

attributes.action: Debate if Parliament is adequately representing the 48% and moderate Leavers
attributes.background: Remainers accept the Referendum outcome, but many feel that this government's current hard Brexit policy does not represent the 48% who voted Remain and the moderate Leavers who hoped for a softer Brexit. We want Parliament to debate if the current proceedings truly represent The Will of the People.
attributes.additional_details: We voted to leave the EU but did not vote upon the terms of our exit, which were never debated during the run up to the referendum, only speculated upon. HM Government's current policy seeks to appeal to only a small number of ardent Leavers and does not represent the more moderate desires of Remainers, moderate Leavers and "Regrexiteers, who by many estimates now make up the majority of those who voted. We would ask HM Government to debate if the current policy suitably represents their wishes.

attributes.action: Stop the demolition of the rest facilities on A35 Dorchester
attributes.background:
These are used by approx 2000 people a week. 
Demolishing these toilets is not the answer, they are a necessity. 
Build another rest area or sort the vandalism problem out but you can not just demolish something that is so obviously needed.
What happened to drivers being encouraged to rest.
attributes.additional_details:
Even Highways England have not denied how busy these facilities are, their reason for demolition is vandalism. 
Demolishing these toilets is not the answer. Shame on you Highways England.

attributes.action: Give excess Army rations to homeless
attributes.background: During the whole of the 2015/16 financial year 10,798 Army ORP (Operational Ration Packs) were disposed of, and 5,004 in the year before that.

attributes.action: Bullying that results in suicide should be treated as manslaughter.
attributes.background: Anyone who bullies a person so they feel the only way out is to take their own life should be charged with manslaughter and punished to the full extent of the law.

attributes.action: Remove the ban on disabled refugees.
attributes.background: It has just been revealed that the government has been refusing to consider applications from individuals with disabilities fleeing war-torn countries since January. Shutting the most desperate, vulnerable people out is an affront to British values and applications must be reconsidered immediately.

attributes.action: Examine the practicalities of introducing a ringfenced tax to help fund the NHS.
attributes.background:
The truth is that the UK is falling further behind other European countries in how much is spent on health. It is time to examine a dedicated ringfenced health and care tax.

The Treasury has estimated that a 1p rise in income tax would raise £3.9bn this year, rising to £4.5bn the year after.
attributes.additional_details:
Linking tax income with health and care spending would give people the opportunity to see how their money is being spent, and allow a legitimate debate about what is an appropriate level of taxation required to ensure a sustainable funding settlement for the NHS and social care system in the years to come. 

The Treasury has estimated that a 1p rise in income tax would raise £3.9bn this year, rising to £4.5bn next year and then £4.6bn in 2018-19. Without major reforms to how care is provided, the NHS in England is facing a £22bn gap in its finances by 2020-21.

attributes.action: Change the law that states you have to do 3 sciences for GCSE.
attributes.background: I am a 12 year old girl. have just chosen my GCSE's and I think it is wrong that I have to do 3 sciences. I think we should change the law so it is that we have to do 2 sciences and then have the choice to do 1 more science or a different subject.
attributes.additional_details: The law currently states that GCSE students have to do all 3 sciences and the reasoning for this is that there needs to be more women in scientific jobs. This law does not help those who do not want to have a career in science. I think that the law should be changed so that GCSE students do 2 sciences and then chose either 1 more science or a different subject. This means you are not losing a GCSE or a qualification, just possibly a science.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for NHS staff.
attributes.background: Many  companies provide discounts for their staff. Hardworking NHS staff also deserve a discounts.

attributes.action: A motion to call a vote on MPs confidence in the government's future NHS plans.
attributes.background: NHS is under increasing strain. Staff are overworked, NHS vacancies are left unfilled (highlighting a need for increased training through government subsides) and doctors have been accused of not doing enough. This cannot continue. We need a change of plan which should be put to a parliament vote.
attributes.additional_details:
ITV report https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jAg2aHgVBSA 
Sky News Report http://www.classicfm.com/radio/news/uk-world/nhs-crisis-theresa-may-frustrated-over-gp-ope/
Debate with lots of evidence http://parliamentlive.tv/event/index/b18b254b-2450-4a4d-86d0-947792490a6c?in=16:30:00
Leak showing extent of 2017 winter crisis http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-38570960

attributes.action: Mandatory for all employers to offer a phased return to work for new parents
attributes.background: Offering working parents a phased return to work will help to provide a smoother transition back to work. Providing the stay at home parent with an enhanced support system and allowing the working parent more time to form a positive relationship without as much of a financial burden.

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Include School Transport to salary sacrifice schemes to enable tax/NI savings
attributes.background: Many working parents are facing high costs for self funding school transport. For some families this can be £1000s each year. We would like school transport vouchers to be included in the government salary sacrifice schemes in the same way that childcare vouchers and cycle to work schemes are.
attributes.additional_details: The government currently funds school transport for children attending their nearest school, for many families the nearest school is not the best option so they choose to self-fund transport and send their child to another school. For parents making this decision they are generating £1000s in cost savings to local councils as the council no longer has the financial obligation to provide transport. We ask the government to support working families with this simple change.

attributes.action: Make equal rights the heart of any trade deal with America.
attributes.background: Soon we will begin discussions with America on a trade deal; we should ensure that equal worker rights based on gender, sexuality, religion and race will be enshrined in this deal.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has always had a special relationship with America. This relationship has been forged as two nations who have fought side by side to defend the rights of the individual. Brexit has given us an opportunity to create our own trade deals with nations. We should use these trade deals to cement the shared values we hold dear.

attributes.action: Include women in the national screening programme for abdominal aortic aneurysms
attributes.background: Public Health England run a national screening programme for men aged ≥65 to detect abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). If left undetected, a AAA rupture is fatal in 90% of cases. The condition is not unique to men, women also suffer and die from AAA ruptures. So why aren't women also screened?
attributes.additional_details:
Screening is a way of detecting an aneurysm early. If the abdominal aortic artery gets particularly swollen, you might feel a pulsating feeling or pain in your stomach or back pain. If you don't experience this, you won’t know you have an aneurysm until it bursts, when it becomes an emergency and is usually fatal.
Ruptured AAAs are less common in women and, on average, occur 10 years later than in men.So why is there not a screening programme for women aged 75 or above? Women are equal!

attributes.action: Ban use of satellite navigation visual aids for black cab and private hire trade
attributes.background: Public safety should not be abused by allowing drivers of black cabs and private hire vehicles the elevated chance of being distracted and a danger to person or property whislt operating a vehicle and satellite navigation simultaneously whislt booked. Dont keep loved ones at risk with that booking.
attributes.additional_details: As stated on the gov.uk website under the policy paper regarding improving the driving test updated 25 August 2015, demonstrates there is evidence in the government's view to explore both the correlation between distrations, the causes of accidents and the need to perhaps introduce a baseline standard for drivers to demonstrate the ability to use satellite navigation safely. The general public in the interim of findings should be risk protected. Use of sat nav should be customer opt in only.

attributes.action: Declassify intelligence related to possible Russian interference on Brexit vote
attributes.background: The CIA, FBI and NSA jointly concluded that Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign on the 2016 US Election using social media and cyber attacks. Russia would benefit from a weakened European Union. We deserve to be sure the EU Referendum was a free and fair vote without influence.
attributes.additional_details:
US declassified report: https://www.dni.gov/files/documents/ICA_2017_01.pdf

EU sanctioned Russia over crisis in Syria: https://europa.eu/newsroom/highlights/special-coverage/eu_sanctions_en

Like the US Election, the EU Referendum result was not predicted by polls: http://whatukthinks.org/eu/opinion-polls/poll-of-polls/

MI6 Chief, Anthony Young, commented states "further their aims deniably" by "subversion of democratic process": https://www.ft.com/content/2a433552-bd4c-11e6-8b45-b8b81dd5d080

attributes.action: Add Euro Indexation to the State Pension triple-lock
attributes.background: Since the Brexit vote on 23 June, the value of the pound has been falling. Those on private pensions have seen a surge in value as international companies and world markets prosper. Average earnings and the consumer price index will remain muted, leading to a fall in the value of the State Pension.
attributes.additional_details: On 23 June, the pound was worth 1.30169 Euro (ref. OANDA) - by the end of the year it had lost more than 10% of its value. This trend is likely to continue. By November, the CPI was only 1.2% (ref. ONS). - The Pensions Committee is thinking of scrapping the triple-lock, but we suggest replacing "or 2.5%" with "or 1.30169/FX" where FX is the value of the Pound in terms of the Euro.

attributes.action: Allow children access to more speech therapy on the NHS.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to offer more speech therapy on the NHS.  I have been fighting to get my son help for 2 years. We have to pay privately for someone to listen to us. We are seen weekly privately, but the NHS won't offer anywhere close to this. Our son has made so much progress having weekly sessions.

attributes.action: Men to be given automatic parental responsibility like women when a baby is due.
attributes.background: Woman have fought hard for their equal rights and they got it, which is just right, but when it comes to pregnancy men do not have the same rights as women and I aim to change that. I am a father to be and I have discovered that a father has to be registered on the birth certificate to have the....
attributes.additional_details: same rights as the mother to their new born child unless courts say otherwise. I want you to ask yourself something, what happens when both parents break up and the mother has a severe dislike to the father? lots of people act out of anger. The father has to pay thousands of pounds just to see his child a few days a week when he probably doesn't deserve that kinda treatment. people judge today by the actions of stupid men in the past but if we are all equal then why is the father the outcast?

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid payments at the beginning of the next fiscal year.
attributes.background: We need to reallocate all funds to projects within the UK, such as homeless shelters built in every city in the UK with a full time GP, medical and social care staff including drug and alcohol abuse, PTSD, catering and educational facilities and education and retraining facilities.
attributes.additional_details: That for a period of one year no foreign aid be paid and that at the end of that year, the government then uses a jury picked in the same way as the current judicial system to hear each case of requested aid from foreign countries. Furthermore that a list of qualifying criteria is put in place prior to any allocation of funds. Such as no country with a GDP higher than ours can request money, that the goverent of the country is an elected one, that the country does not have a nuclear program.

attributes.action: Any EU national came after BREXIT referendum Should not get right to Stay in UK
attributes.background:
UK is already overcrowded,
NHS is streched, 
British Family is struggling to get choice of education as schools are already over crowded, 
EU haven't provided guarantee for UK national so why should uk give guarantee for EU national
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority has said the EU membership fee figure of £19 billion a year, or £350 million a week,
The UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Britons' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU,even though there are significantly more EU citizens in the UK than UK citizens in the EU.
For example the UK pays France £147,685,772, but France only pays UK £6,730,292 and the UK pays Germany £25,873,954 but Germany only pays the UK £2,189,664

attributes.action: Stop all chain supermarkets selling eggs from battery and barn hens by 2018
attributes.background: We read about the poor conditions that some animals live in and want to end the cruelty. Chickens are a start to achieving our goal because the effects gained from this would be most beneficial.
attributes.additional_details: There are already systems being put into place by some stores, but these aren't expected to come into action for several years. We think that this change should happen quicker so that there is no more unnecessary suffering in the egg industry. We hope that by doing this the supermarkets will eventually eliminate all products that leave animals in terrible, cruel and inhumane situations.

attributes.action: hold referendum on ending public financing of the royal family.
attributes.background: redecorating Buckingham palace will cost the taxpayer 367 million pounds, why isn't this very wealthy family responsible for the maintenance of the properties they live in? A referendum should be held for us to decide if they should continue to receive any finance from British taxpayers.

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Ban cropping/clipping of a dog's ears
attributes.background: Ban the cropping/clipping of a dogs ears, unless it's for medical reasons. Most commonly seen in pit breeds, cropping a puppies ears purely for cosmetic reasons is mutilation. It's cruel and serves no purpose for their health. Only for the owners enjoyment.

attributes.action: Allow our FIREFIGHTERS to use seized & impounded vehicles for training purposes.
attributes.background: FIREFIGHTERS have to purchase scrap vehicles in order to train in essential skills such as roof & door removal, car fires & people extraction so that WE can be saved in emergency situations. WHY are we crushing vehicles seized at the roadside when we could GIVE these to the FIRE FIGHTERS!? Help NOW!
attributes.additional_details: Firefighters have to buy scrap vehicles from their own budgets at times when front line services are being cut and cars, seized at the roadside by the Police are being crushed into cubes when they could be used in training. Purchased vehicles are used VERY sparingly in order to extend training as they cannot afford to buy them when seized cars are being cubed daily. These skills that require practice save lives - please sign this petition as it could be your life saved by your signature one day!

attributes.action: Provide free accommodation for ex-service personnel
attributes.background: As Veterans have served our country and risked their lives, why should they be left out in the cold with no food or water. All Veterans should be given accommodation after leaving the Forces until they are able to support themselves again.

attributes.action: Fathers should not pay CSA if they don´t have access to their child
attributes.background: Mothers who claim CSA and do not let fathers see their child shouldn't be allowed to do so. A parent can´t have the best of both worlds claiming CSA and deny the other parent access, its not fair and its not right.
attributes.additional_details: I understand some cases are different i.e the other parent is dangerous for the child to stay with. In these cases CSA should still be available.

attributes.action: Introduce plain packaging with health warnings on unhealthy fast food
attributes.background: Obesity is a major health problem in modern society and rivals the problems caused by smoking tobacco products, and should be treated like it by introducing plain packaging just like cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details:
Obesity causes many different and complex health implications including, but not limited to; cancer, cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes. By 2050, obesity is estimated to affect 60% of adult men and 50% of adult women in addition to 25% of children. The resulting NHS cost is projected to reach (by 2050) £9.7 billion and further costs to society are estimated to be £49.9 billion per year.
Reference - http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a service provider to have a premium rate phone number.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for service providers to have a premium rate phone number so contacting them regarding their services is of great personal cost. This should cover, delivery companies, all house hold bills and any shops that you need to contact for any reason relating to a goods or service bought.

attributes.action: Reconsider the decision to remove housing benefit for young people (18 - 21)
attributes.background:
More jobless young people could be made to live on the streets as the Government moves ahead with plans to end housing support payments for under-21s.

On Friday officials published secondary legislation to go ahead with the plans, while most MPs were at home in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1:
 http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/housing-benefit-young-people-18-21-scrapped-universal-credit-exemptions-a7610581.html

attributes.action: Allow people who are born blind in one eye, to register as partially sighted.
attributes.background: If you are born with eyesight in one eye you, cant register as partially sighted unless you have problems with your other eye.

attributes.action: Change the definition of rape to cover forceful envelopment of a penis or digit
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 defines rape as the penetration of the vagina, anus or mouth of another person with a penis. By this definition, a woman cannot rape a man or another woman. The law should be changed to include the forceful envelopment of a penis or digit

attributes.action: For the production, sale & use of whole plant medical cannabis to be legal.
attributes.background:
Exempts patients & defined caregivers who possess or cultivate marijuana for medical treatment recommended by a physician from criminal laws which otherwise prohibit possession or cultivation of marijuana.
Furthermore, legalise the sale of medical marijauna in dispensaries for these patients only.
attributes.additional_details:
Medical marijuana has been seen to improve the lives of some of the patients (in some cases reverse) with the following conditions: Alzheimer's disease, arthritis, ADHD, ASD, autoimmune diseases, cachexia, cancer, CFS, GI disorders , fibromyalgia, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, insomnia, MS, neuropathy, Parkinson's disease, PTSD, seizure disorders and many others.
Notably the whole plant as it's compounds work in synergy. 
Additionally, in all these cases the benefits far outweigh the supposed dangers.

attributes.action: Take more action to reduce activities that contribute to global climate change.
attributes.background: Deployment of mitigation technologies, as well as deployment of non fossil fuel energy sources will be necessary to achieve a stabilization of the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Support renewables, divest from fossil fuels, tackle pollution and stop Fracking.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenfacts.org/en/climate-change-ar4/
http://www.greenfacts.org/en/climate-change-ar5-science-basis/index.htm
One Million Climate Jobs: Tackling the Environmental and Economic Crisis http://www.campaigncc.org/climatejobs

attributes.action: Apply VAT on airfares to better fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is underfunded; at the end of 2015/16 the NHS had a deficit of £1.85 billion. Aviation is lightly taxed but harmful, eg it impairs children's learning ability and is detrimental to wildlife. It is also exacerbating our climate crisis and in 2014 produced over 11% of the UK’s total emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
Airline passengers do not pay fuel duty or VAT and APD can be as low as £13. We might think this makes annual holidays affordable but in fact undertaxed flights largely benefit affluent people who fly several times a year; 70% of flights are taken by only 15% of adults.

My petition is to apply VAT on airfares and for the additional revenue to be used to support our NHS. Most of us like an annual holiday but those of us who can afford 2 to 3 holidays each year can also afford to pay more tax.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid contribution from 0.7% to 0.2% GDP
attributes.background: In the current climate of government cuts to our Local authorities, NHS and social funding (specifically OAP) it is completely unacceptable to be sending approximately 12 billion pounds of UK tax payers money out of the country when our own services are failing.

attributes.action: Increase fines and ban cyclists from the road who jump red lights.
attributes.background:
It seems to becoming more apparent that cyclists in London and more recently Manchester are failing to stop at red lights, risking serious injuries to pedestrians.

The problem has also been increased by delivery companies using cyclists to deliver goods and failing to stop at red lights.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Institute of Advanced Motorists, 57% of cyclists admit to running red lights. A 2013 YouGov poll found that 35% of cyclists admit to ignoring red lights at least “occasionally.”

If caught jumping a red light, cyclists can be issued a Fixed Penalty Notice of £30.

The Law is unfair. A motorist jumping a light,  will lead to a Fixed Penalty Notice of 3 points and £100 fine.

The same Law should  apply to cyclists who should also carry third party insurance as a minimum.
